message: @rdpate Ah, I sometimes do that when they were busy while I was asleep. :)
I see you have been in the SO chat last night. Don't want to tell us your nick? :)
I figure if I don't talk in the room I can watch from time to time and it doesn't leave a trace
@sbi: you could disable the paper clip :D
@rdpate I did so by uninstalling Office 97 the same week I had it installed.
hah
I seem to remember that things changed much more drastically after 97 than between 95 and 97
ah, guilty as charged!
sbi: (if you ever show up) as I said, office 97, but it was, like you, because I *preferred* it over the newer versions
I guess the DOS part of grrm's quote got to me more than WordStar :)
I believe I used 95 at one point too
and I'm probably evangelizing convore more than I think it deserves right now, because I want to give it a kick and see what I get back out of it :)
the stars are a really good feature for that
they aren't presented as in SO's chat; I'm really not sure what they're used for
I don't know if dated "topics" are a good idea or not, but I'm going to try it
@rdpate Actually I have joined cxx.
That makes no sense. If you're using the stars, you do leave a trace. :)
no no, seeing what other people star :)
Ha, you can star your own message here! I should write a bot starring all of mine.
btw, I'm trying out this "room" as my public chat room; I don't mind if you talk here without me, of course, but there's also https://convore.com/cxx/ for c++
it seems to work out well to hit the high points
no, public
But you do use the SO chat stars, you've just told me you're reading those starred messages regularly.
(maybe the convore people aren't either ;)
Ah, so stars are private here, akin to favorites.
so many times there I wished I could customize some small detail in a way I found obvious, and not only could I not, no one else could write a client that allowed that either :(
interesting. I also don't see a way to see messages you've starred (which you can do on SO chat), that could be useful (though I never used it on SO chat...)
@sbi: there's a convore api which they (seemingly) encourage you to use, which is completely opposite of SO chat and a killer feature for me
yes
http://www.woltermanns.com/misc/cookies_Adams.htm
always liked that story from the book, never knew it was real
